bill.title: An original resolution authorizing the reporting of committee funding resolutions for the period October 1, 2013, through February 28, 2015.

item.name: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration

item.title: An original resolution authorizing the reporting of committee funding resolutions for the period October 1, 2013, through February 28, 2015.
An original resolution authorizing the reporting of committee funding resolutions for the period October 1, 2013, through February 28, 2015.

latestAction.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7170)

item.text:
Provides that by September 20, 2013, each Senate committee shall report one resolution authorizing the committee to make expenditures out of the contingent fund of the Senate to defray its expenses, including the compensation of staff members, for October 1, 2013, through February 28, 2015.

Authorizes the Committee on Rules and Administration to report one authorization resolution containing more than one committee authorization resolution for such period.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Provides that by September 20, 2013, each Senate committee shall report one resolution authorizing the committee to make expenditures out of the contingent fund of the Senate to defray its expenses, including the compensation of staff members, for October 1, 2013, through February 28, 2015.

Authorizes the Committee on Rules and Administration to report one authorization resolution containing more than one committee authorization resolution for such period.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
